title: `GitRepo.get_submodules_()` implementation issues

labels.name: performance
labels.description: Improve performance of an existing feature

body:
Investigating #4859 and following-up on #5061 this is an investigation of the scope and usage of related functionality.

- any call to `GitRepo.get_submodule_()` implies:
  - parsing `.gitmodules` via a call to `GitRepo._parse_gitmodules()`
  - a call to `GitRepo.get_content_info()` to obtain submodule state info
    - in case no `paths` are given as constraints, content info for all dataset content is queried, and only in a second step non-submodule results are discarded
    - **Issue 1:** why not constrain the query to the paths of submodules, which are already known after parsing `.gitmodules`?
- under particular circumstances `GitRepo.get_content_info()` calls `GitRepo.get_submodules_()` which in turn calls `GitRepo.get_content_info()`.
  - so **Issue 1** cannot be addressed AFAICS without #5061, as otherwise we would get an infinite loop.
  - **Issue 2:** calling `GitRepo.get_submodules_(paths)` leads to `GitRepo._parse_gitmodules()` being called twice
